title: What is your favorite book on wisdom and philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, the books which are popular are so because most of the people understand their underlying ideas after they read them. Books which a layman does not read are often shrouded in layers of complexity. But if you seriously want to grab a serious piece of wisdom, here are some books: The myth of sisyphus by Albert Camus.Crime and Punishment by Fyodor Dostoyevsky.The brothers Karamazov by Fyodor Dostoyevsky.Beyond good and evil by Friedrich Nietzsche.Thus spoke Zarathustra by Friedrich Nietzsche.Critique of pure reason by Kant.Nausea by Jean-Paul Sartre.Besides the above books, here are some books which you might want to read for their insights into human life: One hundred years of solitude by Gabriel Garcia MarquezLord of the flies by William Golding.Blindness by Josè Saramago.Seeing by Josè Saramago.Manuscripts found in Accra by Paulo Coelho.Good luck. Read well. \U0001f603

Our own Self is the best favourite book on Wisdom and our own life is the best on philosophy. Only difficulty is learning how to read it. In Tamil “Kadavul” means “GOD”. Here ‘Kada’ means ‘pass through’ and ‘ul’ means ‘inside”. That is ‘pass through inside’. Everything is available there. Donot try to possess it. Don’t rely too much on books for wisdom which is different from knowledge. Whatever possible to bring into a book only available. Start with J.Krishnamurthy’s Truth and Actuality.
